conclusion: Analyze each phase of the motion separately to determine total displacement.
Deceleration phase with initial velocity 30 m/s, final velocity 5 m/s, and deceleration -1 m/s².
Use kinematic equation to find distance during deceleration: d1 = 437.5 m.
Constant speed phase with speed 5 m/s and distance before the centerline 10 m.
Acceleration phase with initial velocity 5 m/s, final velocity 30 m/s, and acceleration 1 m/s².
Use kinematic equation to find distance during acceleration: d2 = 437.5 m.
